08:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> Hi ClemensR, the installation was made using deb package. In path "/etc/tomcat7/Catalina/localhost", they are two file one ROOT.xml and the second xwiki.xml. The diffence of this two files it the value of the variable "PATH" set one time at "/" and the second at "/xwiki".  
08:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_9> But if I restart the tomcat with ROOT:xml file, the web page is not correctly visible?

10:09 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
10:09 <vmassol> at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/JavaScriptAPI#HGetsomeinformationsaboutthecurrentdocument it says "In your javascript's applications, you can get (meta) information about the current document, though an AMS module.". It should be AMD right?  
10:09 <mflorea> good morning  
10:09 <mflorea> yes, AMD  
10:09 <vmassol> thx  
10:10 <mflorea> np  
10:10 <vmassol> second question  
10:10 <vmassol> in order to use that xwiki-meta module in xwiki.js for example  
10:10 <vmassol> I need to use rthe requirejs construct right?  
10:10 <vmassol> \*the  
10:10 <mflorea> yes  
10:10 <vmassol> asking since we're not using requirejs anywhere in there  
10:11 <mflorea> not yet  
10:11 <vmassol> ok I need to read up a bit on requirejs I think  
10:11 <vmassol> to know if I need to wrap the whole content of xwiki.js or not  
10:12 <mflorea> both are possibl  
10:12 <mflorea> a call to require() is like "execute this code after loading these deps"  
10:12 <vmassol> yes but the var you define inside are local?  
10:13 <mflorea> you don't have to wrap the entire code, but usually it's the case  
10:13 <vmassol> I guess you need it to share the variables  
10:13 <vmassol> no?  
10:13 <vmassol> maybe not actually  
10:13 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> since you can use XWiki.xxxx which are global  
10:14 <mflorea> well, anything declared with var is local. If you don't use var then it's global  
10:14 <vmassol> will try  
10:14 <vmassol> :)  
10:14 <msmeria> has quit  
10:15 <RamonaConoro> has quit  
10:15 <RamonaConoro1> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, what would be the best way to debug REST API calls ("Could not convert the message body to a org.xwiki.rest.model.jaxb.Page" exception), sometimes this exception occurs and i cannot find any evidence in logs, only the stacktrace that is printed to client  
10:39 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: I guess the way I would do it is by putting some breakpoint in the server side code to see what happens but you need a dev environment set up for this...  
10:39 <vmassol> otherwise it could reproduce it, you could raise a jira issue listing the steps to reproduce  
10:42 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: yup, i'm gonna try to strip the REST call to the actual issue, without non-relevant data  
10:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: I see on https://github.com/isagalaev/highlight.js that it says: "Highlight.js is a syntax highlighter written in JavaScript. It works in the browser as well as on the server. " Could be interesting! I guess the server side would execute inside Rhino but that could be interesting since it won't require loading jython  
10:43 <vmassol> full doc at https://highlightjs.org/  
10:43 <vmassol> " • multi-language code highlighting" would be nice for us if it works fine  
10:43 <tmortagne> "as well as on the server" you could say that from any javascript library  
10:43 <vmassol> hmm actually maybe they refeer to node.js  
10:43 <tmortagne> yes  
10:43 <tmortagne> that's what I meant  
10:44 <vmassol> I don't think any js will just run in node js, the code has to be designed for that no?  
10:44 <tmortagne> now rhino is not really better than jython on performance side so not sure it would really bring anything  
10:44 <tmortagne> plus I'm pretty sure pygments support more languages  
10:44 <vmassol> 130 languages is not bad  
10:45 <vmassol> and what's intesting is that in revent JVM rhino is being replaced by some better js engine  
10:45 <tmortagne> "a wide range of over 300 languages and other text formats is supported" for pygments  
10:45 <vmassol> so it could make sense in the future  
10:45 <tmortagne> and not even sure this line is up to date  
10:45 <tmortagne> (they add tons of new language at each release)  
10:45 <vmassol> rhino is replaced by nashorn in java8 AFAIK  
10:46 <tmortagne> yes  
10:50 <vmassol> btw just noticed that data-xwiki-rest-url="//rest/wikis/xwiki/spaces/Main/spaces/VMA/pages/WebHome" is wrong…. checking  
10:51 <vmassol> creating an issue for guillaume… :)  
11:03 <RamonaConoro1> has quit  
11:04 <mflorea> tmortagne: query manager module build is failing  
11:05 <tmortagne> mflorea: what error do you get ? I fixed an issue with a leftover @Component annotation this morning  
11:06 <mflorea> there's an error in a unit test  
11:06 <mflorea> java.lang.NoSuchFieldException: isActive  
11:06 <mflorea> Tests in error:  
11:06 <mflorea>   HiddenDocumentFilterTest.filterHQLStatementWithDisplayHiddenDocumentsInTheUserPreferences:77 » NoSuchField  
11:07 <tmortagne> checking  
11:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <tmortagne> right, I just moved this field in a base class, I tough I had executed mvn clean install before the commit  
11:08 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <tmortagne> using a better reflection tool  
11:09 <mflorea> ok  
11:10 <tmortagne> xwiki-platform Quality Checks job is failing with an error I never saw  
11:11 <tmortagne> did someone change its configuration ?  
11:11 <tmortagne> s/change/changed/  
11:12 <tmortagne> seems to have an issue with some xvnc command line option  
11:13 <tmortagne> sounds like it's using the job name in some command without putting " around it  
11:15 <tmortagne> looks like https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/browse/JENKINS-19139  
11:19 <tmortagne> renaming the job  
11:56 <spawn57> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <spawn57> hi, can I use velocity to create a document from a template page?  
12:01 <vmassol> spawn57: sure  
12:01 <vmassol> you can simply copy the template doc and you're good :)  
12:01 <vmassol> $xwiki.copyDocument()  
12:01 <spawn57> ah oki, I was thinking that too, I couldn't find anything regarding templates  
12:02 <spawn57> is there way to see the script used in 'create page'?  
12:02 <vmassol> you can then change some config using velocity  
12:02 <vmassol> like title, parent, etc  
12:02 <spawn57> ad page event..  
12:02 <vmassol> its not a script  
12:02 <spawn57> right, i got you.  Thanks!  
12:02 <vmassol> it's some java code  
12:02 <spawn57> ah damn  
12:02 <spawn57> alright  
12:02 <vmassol> if you want to check it  
12:03 <vmassol> it's the edit action I think  
12:03 <vmassol> checking  
12:03 <vmassol> yep  
12:03 <vmassol> EditAction  
12:03 <vmassol> readFromTemplate()  
12:04 <vmassol> the code calls XWikiDocument.readFromTemplate  
12:04 <vmassol> ()  
12:04 <vmassol> spawn57: here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java#L3701-3701  
12:05 <vmassol> you can do the same from a script  
12:05 <vmassol> if you have PR  
12:05 <spawn57> wow, thanks  
12:05 <vmassol> you can just create a new XWikiDocumnt() and then call readFromTemplate  
12:05 <vmassol> to fill it  
12:06 <spawn57> in velocity?  
12:06 <vmassol> sure, but you'll need PR  
12:06 <spawn57> that would be better than copying in my situation.  
12:06 <RamonaConoro> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <spawn57> I'm giving it a PR.  
12:06 <vmassol> PR= programming right

13:12 <helge> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <helge> FYI: upgrade from 7.0.1 to 7.1.1 is impossible with UrlRewriteFilter for short URLs active.  
13:35 <vmassol> hi helge  
13:36 <vmassol> would be interesting to know more about the problem  
13:39 <helge> vmassol: Dependency [org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwikipreferences-7.1.1] is incompatible with installed root extension [org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwikipreferences-7.0.1]  
13:40 <helge> had to upgrade a lot of dependencies manually  
13:40 <helge> that was only possible after I disabled UrlRewriteFilter  
13:40 <vmassol> helge: what would be great is if you could raise a jira issue listing the steps to reproduce  
13:40 <helge> took me a while to find this out  
13:40 <Enygma`> tmortagne, vmassol: any idea why we clear the security document in XWikiDocument#setAsContextDoc (and additionally in the backupContext/restoreContext methods pair)? The way I see it, once a sdoc is set, all the subsquent executions should use it and never override it, otherwise it kind of loses its meaning.  
13:40 <Enygma`> In my case, a sheet document does $doc.getRenderedContent(content, syntax, etc...) and the result is the used PR (or SR in my case) are the ones of the $doc and not of the sheet document, which is wrong IMO.  
13:40 <vmassol> then I could have a look at it to fix it  
13:41 <vmassol> Enygma`: sorry, I don't know the answer, never really focused on sdoc and I don't know that much about it  
13:43 <helge> vmassol: ok  
13:46 <Enygma`> we set it in a couple of places (includes, sheet rendering, at the like) to say that the PR check (and SR check now) are to be done on the author of the sdoc (the document containing the code) and not of the current doc (the document executing the code). However, if we end up in recursive calls, IMO we should not override the sdoc (if it is set) in each recursive step, since we end up canceling its effect for some recursive levels (like $doc.getRenderedContent  
13:47 <vmassol> has quit  
13:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <vmassol> wow, second time 3 days that my mac crashes :(  
13:47 <vmassol> I must have a problem...  
13:47 <vmassol> hope it's not xwiki that does this ;)  
13:48 <Enygma`> it's usually the HDDs or the cooling, my money is on the cooling these days :)  
13:49 <vmassol> not too hot here though  
13:49 <vmassol> I'd say 22 degres inside  
13:49 <vmassol> the fan was not even running when it crashed...

14:22 <vmassol> the crash happened during a git operation...  
14:24 <helge> has quit  
14:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: what about a new method in EntityReference: List<String> extractReferenceNames(EntityType type) ?  
14:25 <vmassol> either this or something to convert List<EntityReference> into a List<String>  
14:26 <vmassol> getReversedReferenceChain() —> List<EntityReference> —> List<String>  
14:26 <vmassol> the idea would be to make it easy to extract all space names for ex  
14:27 <vmassol> second idea: add a type parameter to getReversedReferenceChain()  
14:27 <vmassol> (new signature)  
14:28 <tmortagne> not sure what you mean by a type parameter  
14:28 <vmassol> for example to call SpaceRefefence.getReversedReferenceChain(EntityType.SPACE)  
14:29 <vmassol> to get only spaces  
14:29 <tmortagne> well there is no reason this return Strings, it would not be very consistent with other methods  
14:29 <vmassol> I've never said it would return string  
14:30 <vmassol> extractReferenceNames() would  
14:30 <vmassol> getReversedReferenceChain() returns Refs  
14:30 <tmortagne> I don't understand what getReversedReferenceChain is doing in a conversation about getting a list of String instead of a list of reference then  
14:30 <vmassol> as I mentioned you would do it in 2 steps  
14:30 <vmassol> step 1: get a reverse list of space refs  
14:31 <vmassol> step 2: extract the names from the refs  
14:31 <tmortagne> "second idea" sounded like another idea so solve your need of String list  
14:31 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <evalica> has quit  
14:32 <vmassol> the truth is that I'm working on the entyity js api and I was planning of adding something like this there and I thouht it would be nicer to have the same api for both java and js  
14:33 <tmortagne> extractReferenceNames would not do any harm if you need it  
14:33 <tmortagne> it's just another helper  
14:35 <vmassol> need to think more, there are plenty if ways to achieve what I need  
14:35 <vmassol> need to find the best one...  
14:36 <tmortagne> why do you need a list of Strings ?  
14:37 <vmassol> I'm not sure yet :)  
14:37 <vmassol> xwiki.js is a bit of a mess  
14:38 <vmassol> trying to understand XWiki.fromEntityReference() ATM  
14:39 <vmassol> XWiki.resource.fromEntityReference() and get()  
14:50 <RamonaConoro> has quit  
14:56 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:50 <vmassol> mflorea: are you still ok to implement http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12362 ?  
15:50 <vmassol> (that was T15 at http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Proposal/NestedSpaces )  
15:50 <vmassol> just created the issue  
15:51 <vmassol> FTR the one I fixed recently was http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12354 which was different  
15:51 <mflorea> I remember I started a discussion on devs mailing list but I'm not sure we reach a conclusion. In any case, I won't have time to work on that for M2  
15:52 <vmassol> it's not in the list of urgent user stories  
15:52 <vmassol> would be nice if we can have it for 7.2 final though since it's very visible  
15:52 <vmassol> my question ATM is: should you assign yourself to it?  
15:53 <vmassol> (for after the urgent user stories)  
15:53 <vmassol> or should we leave it open for now?  
15:53 <vmassol> s/open/unassigned  
15:54 <mflorea> again, I don't think we decided what to do with the spaces macro (that's why I didn't open the issue before). Because we can either drop the macro and use the document tree instead (which means this issue should be closed as invalid), or enhance the space macro somehow  
15:55 <mflorea> we can leave it unassigned for the moment  
15:59 <vmassol> mflorea: I can only find caty's reply: http://markmail.org/message/44gkztaojvsdejmo  
15:59 <vmassol> can't find your original mail  
16:00 <mflorea> maybe because you're looking at users mailing list  
16:00 <vmassol> you have a link?  
16:01 <vmassol> I'm looking at all lists  
16:01 <mflorea> http://lists.xwiki.org/pipermail/devs/2015-June/058819.html  
16:01 <vmassol> ah maybe it's when we had issues with markail  
16:01 <vmassol> markmail  
16:01 <vmassol> thanks  
16:02 <vmassol> just commented on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12362  
16:02 <vmassol> mflorea: can I let be the repsonsible person for that thread (ie to lead it to conclusion)?  
16:02 <vmassol> \*let you  
16:02 <vmassol> (since you started it)  
16:02 <vmassol> should be easy to agree on this one  
16:03 <mflorea> ok, I'll revive the thread, but I need the rest of the devs to answer  
16:03 <vmassol> that's what responsible means :)  
16:03 <vmassol> ie pushing people to answer  
16:04 <vmassol> I'll answer now on my side  
16:05 <mflorea> ok
